content:
welcome to the official independent studentrun newspaper of Hofstra University

By Joe Pantorno Staff Writer

After its win against no PERIOD  Brown the Pride mens lacrosse team is flying high into their next match against no PERIOD  Johns Hopkins University PERIOD JHU is coming off of a  overtime loss to Princeton a loss that they want to erase from their memory PERIOD

With the big match up looming head coach Seth Tierney is quick to downplay the hype PERIOD  Tierney said PERIOD

Tierney is confident that if the Pride plays its style of game good things are bound to happen PERIOD  said Tierney PERIOD

After a tengoal performance from the Pride midfield against Brown JHU will need to try and cut off Hofstras offsense not only from the midfielders but also Hofstras  junior attackers Jay Card and Jamie Lincoln PERIOD

Playing against JHU is always an experience for Tierney PERIOD The Hopkins alumnus and former assistant coach finds a place in his heart for this game PERIOD  he said PERIOD 

This game should be one of the best of the year and Tierney has a message for Pride fans 



Please note that only current Hofstra students can become part of our staff writing team PERIOD

Thank you for your interest Please click here to join our Slack workspace and indicate your section preferences in the sectionjoinrequests channel PERIOD Thank you and we look forward to working with you
title: Top-10 matchup against Johns Hopkins looms large â€” The Hofstra Chronicle
